docs.title: Cloud Avenue Data Insights
docs.text:
AI-Powered Data Analysis and Exploration Platform

Cloud Avenue Data Insights empowers data teams to query, analyze, and visualize data using natural language. Connect your databases, ask questions in plain English, and get instant insights through interactive charts, tables, and SQL queries—no coding required.

docs.title: 💬 Natural Language Data Analysis
docs.text:
Ask questions about your data in conversational language and receive immediate insights:

  • Query databases without writing SQL
  • Generate visualizations automatically from your questions
  • Explore data patterns through interactive tables and charts
  • Switch between AI models for simple queries or complex analysis

docs.title: 🗄️ Multi-Database Connectivity
docs.text:
Connect to your data wherever it lives:

  • Relational Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQL Server
  • Cloud Data Warehouses: Snowflake, BigQuery
  • Secure Connections: Static IP whitelisting, encrypted credentials, SSL/TLS support

docs.title: 📊 Save and Share Insights
docs.text:
Transform conversations into reusable artifacts:

  • Interactive Tables: Sortable, searchable query results with export capabilities
  • Dynamic Charts: Bar, line, pie, and scatter plots with full customization
  • Refresh Data: Update saved artifacts with latest data on demand
  • Team Collaboration: Share insights across your organization

docs.title: 🚀 Two AI Models for Every Need
docs.text:
• Light Model: Fast responses for quick lookups and straightforward queries
  • Advanced Model: Sophisticated reasoning for complex multi-step analysis

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Ready to explore your data? Follow these steps:

  1. Get Started: Try the demo data source and learn the basics
  2. Connect Your Data: Add your databases and warehouses
  3. Start Chatting: Ask questions and generate insights
  4. Use the API: Integrate programmatically (optional)

docs.title: Enterprise Features
docs.text: For organizations requiring advanced data governance and impact analysis:

docs.title: 🔄 Automated Lineage Tracking
docs.text:
Available for Enterprise accounts

  • GitHub App Integration: Automatically analyze code changes across your data stack
  • Visual Lineage Graphs: Understand data flow and dependencies
  • Platform Integrations: Connect BI tools, orchestration platforms, and more
  • Impact Analysis: See downstream effects of schema or code changes
  • Smart PR Insights: Automated pull request comments with impact details

Learn more about Enterprise features

docs.title: Supported Integrations (Enterprise)
docs.text:
Cloud Avenue integrates with your entire modern data stack:

BI & Analytics: Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Superset, Lightdash Data Warehouses: Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Databricks, Synapse Data Integration: dbt, Airflow, Fivetran, Matillion, Informatica, AWS Glue Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Cassandra, and 20+ more

View all supported technologies

docs.title: Key Benefits
docs.text:
For Data Analysts - Query data without SQL expertise - Create shareable visualizations instantly - Spend less time on repetitive queries

For Data Engineers - Provide self-service data access to teams - Reduce ad-hoc query requests - Monitor data quality through automated checks

For Engineering Teams (Enterprise) - Prevent breaking changes before deployment - Understand code impact across the data stack - Streamline code reviews with automated insights

docs.title: Security & Privacy
docs.text:
• Data Encryption: All data encrypted in transit and at rest
  • Data Retention: Only encrypted snapshots stored for artifact functionality
  • Access Control: Role-based permissions and secure authentication

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Getting Started Guide: Quick setup for new users
  • Chat Documentation: Complete guide to the chat interface
  • Data Sources: Database connection instructions
  • API Reference: Programmatic integration guide
  • GitHub App: Enterprise lineage and impact analysis

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
Need help? We're here for you:

  • Email: hello@cloudavenue.ai

Ready to start? Get Started →

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text:
Cloud Avenue Data Insights provides a comprehensive REST API for managing integrations, notifications, and other features programmatically.

You can explore the full API documentation at: https://app.cloudavenue.ai/api/docs

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: All API requests require authentication using an API key. The API key must be included in the X-API-KEY header.

docs.title: Creating an API Key
docs.text:
To create a long-lived API key for accessing the Cloud Avenue API:

  1. Sign in to the Cloud Avenue Portal
  2. Click on your profile avatar in the top-right corner
  3. Select "Manage API Keys" from the dropdown menu
  4. Click the "Add New Key" button
  5. Provide the following details:
    • Name: A descriptive name for your API key (e.g., "Production Integration")
    • Description: Optional description of the key's purpose
    • Expiration: Choose how long the key will be valid:
      • 7 days
      • 30 days
      • 1 year
      • Unlimited (no expiration)
  6. Click "Save" to generate the key

Important: Save Your API Key

The API key will only be displayed once. Make sure to copy and store it securely. If you lose the key, you'll need to create a new one.

docs.title: Using Your API Key
docs.text:
Include your API key in the X-API-KEY header of all API requests:

X-API-KEY: <YOUR_API_KEY>

docs.title: Managing API Keys
docs.text:
You can manage your API keys at any time through the portal:

  • View: See all active and revoked keys with their creation and expiration dates
  • Revoke: Immediately disable a key if it's compromised
  • Delete: Permanently remove a revoked key from your account

docs.title: Integrations
Notifications
docs.text:
Curl Examples Slack

You will need to generate Slack Webhook URL - https://api.slack.com/messaging/webhooks

curl -X 'POST' \
'https://app.cloudavenue.ai/api/notifications/subscriptions' \
-H 'accept: application/json' \
-H 'X-API-KEY: <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{
      "name": "slack01",
      "webhookUrl": "https://hooks.slack.com/services/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",
      "type": "slack",
      "events": [
        "pr_merged_with_impact"
      ]
}'

docs.title: Chat
docs.text: Cloud Avenue Chat is an AI-powered conversational interface for data analysis and exploration. Ask questions in natural language and receive insights, visualizations, and actionable information from your connected data sources.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Chat feature enables you to:

  • Query databases using natural language instead of writing SQL
  • Generate visualizations with charts and graphs
  • Analyze lineage to understand data dependencies
  • Save and share artifacts for future reference
  • Switch between AI models for different use cases

docs.title: Creating a Chat Session
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Chat page from the main navigation
  2. Click "Start New Conversation" or the "+" button
  3. Begin typing your question or request

Each chat session maintains its own conversation history and context, allowing you to have multiple ongoing analyses.

docs.title: Selecting a Data Source
docs.text:
Before querying data, you need to select which database to use:

  1. Click the database icon in the chat title bar (top center)
  2. Choose a data source from the dropdown menu
  3. The selected source is displayed as a chip below the title bar

Once selected, the AI will query this database for all data-related questions in the current session. You can change the data source at any time by clicking the database icon again.

Demo Data Source

A demo data source ("[Demo] Jaffle Shop") is pre-configured for testing. You can use it to explore features before connecting your own databases.

Data Source Persistence

Your data source selection is saved with the chat session, so it will be remembered when you return to the conversation.

docs.title: Model Type Selection
docs.text: Cloud Avenue offers two AI model types optimized for different scenarios:

docs.title: Light Model
docs.text:
• Speed: Faster response times
  • Efficiency: Lower computational cost
  • Use cases: Simple queries, quick lookups, straightforward analysis
  • Best for: Exploratory questions, basic reporting

docs.title: Advanced Model
docs.text:
• Power: More sophisticated reasoning and analysis
  • Accuracy: Better handling of complex queries
  • Use cases: Multi-step analysis, complex aggregations, nuanced interpretations
  • Best for: In-depth investigations, complex business logic

docs.title: Switching Models
docs.text:
You can toggle between model types using the switch in the chat title bar:

  1. Locate the "Light / Advanced" toggle in the top-right area
  2. Click to switch between models
  3. The selection applies immediately to new messages

The model type is saved per session, so each conversation can use a different model based on your needs.

docs.title: Chat Artifacts
docs.text: Artifacts are structured outputs generated by the AI during your conversation. They can be saved, refreshed, and shared across your organization.

docs.title: Artifact Types
docs.text: Cloud Avenue Chat supports three types of artifacts:

docs.title: 1. Lineage Graph
docs.text:
Enterprise Feature

Lineage Graph artifacts are available for Enterprise accounts with connected integrations and GitHub repositories.

Purpose: Visualize data dependencies and relationships across your data ecosystem.

Features:

  • Interactive graph: Pan, zoom, and explore entity relationships
  • Entity types: Tables, views, dashboards, models, and more
  • Dependency tracking: See upstream and downstream dependencies
  • Multi-layer visualization: Understand data flow across systems

Use cases:

  • Impact analysis: What will be affected if I change this table?
  • Root cause analysis: Where does this data originate?
  • Documentation: Visual map of your data architecture

Viewing options:

  • Click an artifact button in the chat to open it in full-screen mode
  • Use graph controls to filter by entity type, search for specific entities
  • Toggle between different view layouts

docs.title: 2. Data Table
docs.text:
Purpose: Display query results in an interactive, sortable table.

Features:

  • Sortable columns: Click column headers to sort ascending/descending
  • Column management: Show/hide columns as needed
  • Search and filter: Find specific rows quickly
  • Row count indicator: See total rows and whether results are truncated
  • Copy functionality: Copy entire table or selected data
  • Export options: Download as CSV or JSON

Generated from:

  • Natural language questions that require data retrieval
  • SQL queries you request
  • Analytical requests that produce tabular results

Modal options (when viewing):

  • Table/SQL toggle: Switch between viewing the data table and the underlying SQL query
  • Dialect indicator: Shows which SQL dialect was used (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.)
  • Database name: Displays which database was queried
  • Source name: Shows which configured data source was used
  • Row count: Total number of rows (e.g., "Showing 100 rows")
  • Truncation indicator: Badge showing "Truncated" if results were limited
  • Copy SQL: Copy the SQL query to your clipboard
  • Save artifact: Save this table for future reference
  • Refresh: Re-run the query to get latest data (for saved artifacts)

docs.title: 3. Chart
docs.text:
Purpose: Visualize data patterns and trends through graphical representations.

Supported chart types:

  • Bar charts: Compare values across categories
  • Line charts: Show trends over time or ordered dimensions
  • Pie charts: Display proportions and percentages
  • Scatter plots: Reveal correlations and distributions

Features:

  • Interactive legends: Click to show/hide data series
  • Tooltips: Hover over data points for detailed information
  • Responsive sizing: Charts adapt to screen size
  • Color customization: Change color schemes (via edit controls)
  • Axis formatting: Customize labels, scales, and units

Chart controls (when viewing):

  • Chart type selector: Switch between bar, line, pie, and scatter charts
  • Axis configuration:
  • X-axis: Select dimension or time field
  • Y-axis: Choose measure(s) to plot
  • Series: Group data by category
  • Color customization: Pick colors for data series
  • Number formatting:
  • Decimal places: Control precision (0-4 decimals)
  • Currency: Format as currency with symbol (USD, EUR, GBP, etc.)
  • Percentages: Display as percentage values
  • Legend position: Top, bottom, left, right, or hidden
  • Stacking options: Stack bars or lines for cumulative views

Modal options:

  • Edit controls: Modify chart configuration without regenerating
  • Save artifact: Save this chart for future reference
  • Refresh: Re-run the query and update the chart (for saved artifacts)
  • Export: Download as PNG image
  • View SQL: See the underlying query that generated the data

docs.title: Saving Artifacts
docs.text:
Artifacts can be saved for future reference:

  1. Click the star icon when viewing an artifact in the modal
  2. The artifact is saved to your account's artifact library
  3. Access saved artifacts from the Artifacts page in the main navigation

Shared Artifacts

Saved artifacts can be viewed by other users in your organization, enabling collaboration and knowledge sharing.

docs.title: Refreshing Artifacts
docs.text:
For Data Table and Chart artifacts connected to a data source, you can refresh them to get the latest data:

  1. Open a saved artifact from the Artifacts page or from chat
  2. Click the refresh icon in the modal header
  3. The query is re-executed against the database
  4. The artifact updates with current data

Refresh status indicators:

  • Idle: Ready to refresh
  • Running: Query is executing
  • Succeeded: Refresh completed successfully
  • Failed: An error occurred (see error message)

Refresh information displayed:

  • Last refreshed timestamp
  • Who last refreshed the artifact
  • Number of times refreshed
  • Refresh count

Lineage Graphs

Lineage graph artifacts cannot be refreshed as they are snapshots of your metadata at a point in time.

docs.title: Sample Questions
docs.text: Cloud Avenue Chat can help with various data analysis tasks. Here are some examples:

docs.title: Data Exploration
docs.text:
• "Show me the top 10 customers by revenue"
  • "What's the average order value by month?"
  • "List all tables in the public schema"

docs.title: Visualization
docs.text:
• "Create a bar chart of sales by region"
  • "Plot revenue trends over the last 12 months"
  • "Show customer distribution by country as a pie chart"

docs.title: Analysis
docs.text:
• "Calculate the year-over-year growth rate"
  • "Find customers who haven't ordered in 90 days"
  • "Compare performance across product categories"

docs.title: Conversation Management
docs.text:
• Sessions list: View all your conversations in the left sidebar
  • Search: Find specific sessions by title
  • Delete: Remove sessions you no longer need
  • Auto-save: All messages are automatically saved

docs.title: Message Actions
docs.text:
• Retry: If an error occurs, click the retry button on the error message
  • Copy: Copy code blocks or SQL queries
  • Feedback: Provide feedback on AI responses

docs.title: Title Generation
docs.text: Chat sessions automatically generate descriptive titles based on your conversation topic. The title appears in the title bar and sessions list.

docs.title: Artifact Modal
docs.text: When you click on an artifact in the chat, it opens in a full-screen modal with various controls:

docs.title: Chart-Specific Controls
docs.text:
• Chart type selector: Switch visualization type
  • Edit panel (right side):
  • Field mappings (X-axis, Y-axis, Series)
  • Chart options (stacking, colors, legend)
  • Number formatting (decimals, currency, percentage)
  • Export: Download chart as image
  • Resize: Modal is responsive to window size

docs.title: Effective Prompting
docs.text:
1. Be specific: Include table names, date ranges, or metrics when known
  2. Provide context: Mention the business question you're trying to answer
  3. Iterate: Refine your question based on initial results
  4. Use examples: Reference existing reports or queries as templates

docs.title: Managing Sessions
docs.text:
1. Descriptive titles: Rename sessions to reflect their purpose
  2. Organize by topic: Keep related analyses in the same session
  3. Share insights: Save important artifacts for team access

docs.title: Data Source Selection
docs.text:
1. Choose the right source: Select databases that contain relevant data
  2. Test with demo: Use the demo source to test questions before production
  3. Consider performance: Large databases may take longer to query

docs.title: Working with Artifacts
docs.text:
1. Save important results: Don't lose valuable insights
  2. Refresh periodically: Keep charts and tables up to date
  3. Document findings: Add context in chat before generating artifacts
  4. Export when needed: Download for presentations or reports

docs.title: "No data source selected" Error
docs.text: Solution: Click the database icon in the title bar and select a data source before asking data questions.

docs.title: Queries Taking Too Long
docs.text:
Possible causes:

  • Complex query with multiple joins
  • Large dataset without indexes
  • Database server under heavy load

Solutions:

  • Simplify your question
  • Add filters to reduce data volume
  • Use the Light model for faster processing
  • Contact your database administrator

docs.title: Incorrect Results
docs.text:
Possible causes:

  • Ambiguous question
  • Missing context
  • Data quality issues

Solutions:

  • Rephrase your question with more specifics
  • Check the SQL query to verify it matches intent
  • Verify data accuracy in the source database
  • Use the Advanced model for complex analysis

docs.title: Artifact Won't Refresh
docs.text:
Possible causes:

  • Data source no longer accessible
  • Database connection issue
  • Permissions changed

Solutions:

  • Verify data source connection in Settings
  • Test connection from Data Sources page
  • Check with database administrator

docs.title: Privacy and Security
docs.text:
• Data isolation: Your chat sessions and artifacts are private to your account
  • Data encryption: All data is encrypted in transit and at rest
  • Data retention: We only store a snapshot of the data needed in an encrypted format for the artifact to function. This data is deleted when the artifact is deleted.

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
For assistance with Chat features:

  • Email: support@cloudavenue.ai
  • In-app feedback: Use the feedback button on messages

docs.title: Data Sources
docs.text: Cloud Avenue Data Insights allows you to connect to your SQL databases and data warehouses to enable interactive data analysis through the Chat feature. Data sources are securely stored and can be reused across multiple chat sessions.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Data sources enable you to:

  • Query Your Data: Run SQL queries and get insights from your databases through natural language
  • Generate Charts: Create visualizations based on your data
  • Build Data Tables: Execute queries and view results in interactive tables
  • Refresh Artifacts: Update saved charts and tables with the latest data

docs.title: Supported Databases
docs.text:
Cloud Avenue Data Insights supports the following database platforms:

  • PostgreSQL: Industry-standard open-source relational database
  • MySQL: Popular open-source relational database
  • MariaDB: MySQL-compatible open-source database
  • Microsoft SQL Server: Enterprise relational database management system
  • Snowflake: Cloud data warehouse platform
  • BigQuery: Google Cloud's fully-managed data warehouse

docs.title: Accessing Data Sources
docs.text:
To manage your data sources:

  1. Sign in to the Cloud Avenue Portal
  2. Navigate to Settings → Data Sources
  3. You'll see a list of all configured data sources

docs.title: Adding a Data Source
docs.text:
To connect a new database:

  1. Click the "Add Source" button

  2. Fill in the connection details:

    • Name: A descriptive name for this connection (e.g., "Production Analytics DB")
    • Dialect: Select your database type from the dropdown
    • Host: Database server hostname or IP address
    • Port: Database server port (default varies by database type)
    • Database: Name of the database/schema to connect to
    • Username: Database username
    • Password: Database password (securely encrypted)
    • Options (Optional): Additional connection parameters in JSON format

  3. Click "Test Connection" to verify the configuration

  4. If the test succeeds, click "Save" to add the data source

Connection Security

All connections originate from Cloud Avenue's static outbound IP address. You can whitelist this IP in your database firewall for secure access. The static IP is displayed in the connection security information section when adding or editing a source.

docs.title: Editing a Data Source
docs.text:
To modify an existing data source:

  1. Click the edit icon next to the data source name
  2. Update the connection details as needed
  3. Test the connection to ensure it still works
  4. Click "Save" to apply changes

Demo Data Source

The demo data source (e.g., "[Demo] Jaffle Shop") is provided for testing and cannot be edited. However, you can delete it if you no longer need it.

docs.title: Deleting a Data Source
docs.text:
To remove a data source:

  1. Click the delete icon next to the data source name
  2. Confirm the deletion when prompted

Deletion Impact

Deleting a data source will not affect previously generated artifacts, but you won't be able to refresh them or create new queries against this connection.

docs.title: Database-Specific Configuration
docs.text: Each database type requires specific connection parameters. The UI form will guide you through the required fields based on your selected database dialect.

docs.title: PostgreSQL
docs.text:
Required Fields:

  • Host: Database server hostname or IP address (e.g., db.example.com)
  • Port: Database port (default: 5432)
  • Database: Database name to connect to
  • Username: Database user account
  • Password: User password (encrypted at rest)

Optional Parameters (via Options field):

  • connect_timeout: Connection timeout in seconds
  • sslmode: SSL mode (disable, require, verify-ca, verify-full)
  • application_name: Application name for connection tracking

docs.title: MySQL / MariaDB
docs.text:
Required Fields:

  • Host: Database server hostname or IP address
  • Port: Database port (default: 3306 for MySQL, 3306 for MariaDB)
  • Database: Database name to connect to
  • Username: Database user account
  • Password: User password (encrypted at rest)

Optional Parameters (via Options field):

  • connect_timeout: Connection timeout in seconds
  • charset: Character set (e.g., utf8mb4)
  • ssl_ca: Path to SSL certificate authority file

docs.title: Microsoft SQL Server
docs.text:
Required Fields:

  • Host: SQL Server hostname or IP address
  • Port: Server port (default: 1433)
  • Database: Database name to connect to
  • Username: SQL Server login username
  • Password: Login password (encrypted at rest)

Optional Parameters (via Options field):

  • driver: ODBC driver name (default: auto-detected)
  • encrypt: Whether to encrypt the connection (yes or no)
  • TrustServerCertificate: Trust server certificate (yes or no)

docs.title: Snowflake
docs.text:
Required Fields:

  • Host: Snowflake account identifier (e.g., myorg-account123)
  • Database: Database name
  • Username: Snowflake username
  • Password: User password (encrypted at rest)

Additional Required Parameters (via Options field in JSON format):

{
  "warehouse": "your_warehouse_name",
  "schema": "your_schema_name"
}

Optional Parameters (via Options field):

{
  "role": "your_role_name",
  "arraysize": 10000
}
  • warehouse: Virtual warehouse to use for queries
  • schema: Default schema within the database
  • role: Role to use for the session
  • arraysize: Number of rows to fetch per batch

docs.title: BigQuery
docs.text:
Required Fields:

  • Host: Your GCP project ID (e.g., my-gcp-project)
  • Database: BigQuery dataset name
  • Password: Service account JSON credentials (paste the entire JSON content)

The service account must have appropriate permissions:

  • bigquery.jobs.create: To run queries
  • bigquery.tables.getData: To read table data
  • bigquery.datasets.get: To access dataset metadata

Optional Parameters (via Options field in JSON format):

{
  "location": "US"
}
  • location: Geographic location for query processing (e.g., US, EU, asia-northeast1)

BigQuery Credentials

The Password field should contain the entire service account JSON file content. The credentials are encrypted before storage and never exposed in responses.

docs.title: Static Outbound IP
docs.text:
All database connections from Cloud Avenue originate from a single static IP address. This allows you to configure your database firewall to accept connections only from this trusted IP.

The static outbound IP is displayed when adding or editing a data source. You can copy this IP and add it to your database's allowlist.

docs.title: Encrypted Credentials
docs.text: All sensitive information, including passwords and credentials, is encrypted at rest using industry-standard encryption. Credentials are never exposed in API responses or logs.

docs.title: Network Security
docs.text:
For enhanced security, Cloud Avenue supports:

  • SSL/TLS encrypted connections to your databases
  • VPN tunnels for private network access (contact hello@cloudavenue.ai for advanced options)
  • IP whitelisting for restricted access

docs.title: Using Data Sources in Chat
docs.text:
Once you've configured a data source, you can use it in the Chat feature:

  1. Start or open a chat session
  2. Click the data source selector in the title bar
  3. Choose the database you want to query
  4. Ask questions or request analyses in natural language

The AI will generate SQL queries, execute them against your selected data source, and present results as tables, charts, or insights.

For more information on using data sources in chat, see the Chat documentation.

docs.title: Connection Test Fails
docs.text:
If the connection test fails:

  1. Verify credentials: Double-check username, password, and database name
  2. Check network access: Ensure your database accepts connections from Cloud Avenue's static IP
  3. Confirm port accessibility: Verify the database port is open and accessible
  4. Review firewall rules: Check that no firewall is blocking the connection
  5. Test locally: Try connecting to the database from another client to isolate the issue

docs.title: Slow Query Performance
docs.text:
If queries are running slowly:

  1. Optimize indexes: Ensure your database has appropriate indexes
  2. Reduce data volume: Consider filtering or aggregating data
  3. Check database load: Verify your database server has sufficient resources
  4. Review query complexity: Simplify complex queries when possible

docs.title: Connection Timeout
docs.text:
If connections are timing out:

  1. Check network latency: High latency can cause timeouts
  2. Increase timeout settings: Contact support for timeout adjustments
  3. Verify database availability: Ensure the database server is running and responsive

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Use read-only accounts: Create database users with read-only permissions for Cloud Avenue
  2. Descriptive naming: Use clear, descriptive names for your data sources
  3. Test connections regularly: Periodically verify that saved connections still work
  4. Secure credentials: Never share database credentials in chat or documentation
  5. Monitor usage: Keep track of query patterns and performance

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
For assistance with data sources:

  • Email: support@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to Cloud Avenue Data Insights! This guide will help you quickly get started with the platform and explore its powerful data analysis capabilities.

docs.title: Quick Start with Chat
docs.text: The fastest way to experience Cloud Avenue is through the Chat interface, which allows you to query and analyze your data using natural language.

docs.title: Step 1: Explore with the Demo Data Source
docs.text:
Cloud Avenue provides a pre-configured demo data source to help you get familiar with the platform:

  1. Navigate to the Chat page from the main navigation
  2. Click "Start New Conversation" to create a new chat session
  3. The demo data source "[Demo] Jaffle Shop" is available for immediate use
  4. Select the demo source using the database icon in the chat title bar

Try Quick Start Questions:

Cloud Avenue provides helpful sample questions to guide your exploration. Simply click on any of the suggested questions to:

  • View sample data from the demo database
  • Generate visualizations and charts
  • Understand table relationships
  • Learn query patterns

These quick start questions demonstrate the types of analyses you can perform with your own data sources.

docs.title: Step 2: Connect Your Own Data Source
docs.text:
Once you're comfortable with the demo environment, connect your production databases:

  1. Navigate to Settings → Data Sources
  2. Click "Add Source"
  3. Fill in your database connection details:
  4. Choose your database type (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Snowflake, BigQuery, etc.)
  5. Enter connection credentials
  6. Test the connection to verify
  7. Click "Save" to add the data source

Your configured data sources will now be available for selection in any chat session.

Connection Security

Cloud Avenue uses a static outbound IP address for all database connections. Whitelist this IP in your database firewall for secure access. The IP address is displayed when adding a data source.

docs.title: Step 3: Analyze Your Data with Chat
docs.text:
Start asking questions about your data in natural language:

  1. Create a new chat session or continue an existing one
  2. Select your data source using the database icon
  3. Type questions like:
    • "Show me total sales by region for this quarter"
    • "What are the top 10 customers by revenue?"
    • "Create a line chart of monthly active users"
  4. Review the AI-generated results, which may include:
    • Data tables with sortable, filterable results
    • Charts and visualizations for trend analysis
    • SQL queries showing how data was retrieved

Model Selection:

Toggle between two AI models based on your needs:

  • Light Model: Fast responses for simple queries and quick lookups
  • Advanced Model: Sophisticated analysis for complex business questions

docs.title: Step 4: Save and Share Artifacts
docs.text:
Preserve valuable insights for future reference and collaboration:

  1. When viewing an artifact (table or chart), click the star icon to save it
  2. Saved artifacts appear in the Artifacts page in the main navigation
  3. Access saved artifacts anytime to:
    • Re-run queries with fresh data (using the refresh button)
    • Share insights with team members
    • Reference previous analyses
    • Export data for presentations

Collaborative Artifacts

Saved artifacts are shared across your organization, enabling team collaboration and knowledge sharing.

docs.title: Step 5: Manage Your Saved Artifacts
docs.text:
The Artifacts page provides centralized management of all saved insights:

  1. Navigate to Artifacts from the main menu
  2. Browse all saved artifacts across your account
  3. Use search and filters to find specific artifacts
  4. Click any artifact to view it in full-screen mode
  5. Refresh data-connected artifacts to get the latest results
  6. Delete artifacts you no longer need

Artifact Types:

  • Data Tables: Query results with interactive controls
  • Charts: Visual representations of your data

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you're familiar with the basics, explore more advanced features:

  • Data Sources: Learn about supported databases and advanced configuration
  • Chat: Discover all chat features, artifact types, and best practices
  • API Reference: Integrate Cloud Avenue programmatically
  • Integrations: Connect additional data platforms (Enterprise only)

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you need assistance:

  • Email Support: hello@cloudavenue.ai
  • Documentation: https://docs.cloudavenue.ai/
  • In-App Feedback: Use feedback buttons throughout the application

Welcome aboard, and happy analyzing! 🚀

docs.title: GitHub App Installation
docs.text:
Enterprise Feature

The GitHub App integration is available for Enterprise accounts. This feature enables automated code impact analysis, lineage tracking, and smart pull request insights across your data stack repositories.

Follow these steps to install and connect the Cloud Avenue Data Insights GitHub App to your account.

STEP 1: Install the GitHub App STEP 2: Select Repositories STEP 3: Link to Your Cloud Avenue Account

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Click the following link to install the Cloud Avenue Data Insights GitHub App: https://github.com/apps/cloud-avenue-data-insights

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Select the repositories you want to gain insights for. Cloud Avenue Data Insights currently supports repositories containing Node.js, Debezium, dbt, and Looker codebases.

If you need support for additional technologies, contact us at hello@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
After installing the GitHub App, you'll be redirected to link it with your Cloud Avenue account. You have two options:

Option A: Connect to Existing Account

If you already have a Cloud Avenue account, sign in with your credentials to link the GitHub installation to your existing account.

Option B: Create New Account

If you're new to Cloud Avenue, you can create a new account during this step. The GitHub installation will be automatically linked to your newly created account.

Once linked, the GitHub App installation will appear in your Cloud Avenue account settings, and you can begin receiving insights from your connected repositories.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After completing the installation:

  • Configure Data Sources to connect your databases
  • Set up Integrations for additional platforms
  • Enable Notifications to receive insights
  • Use the Chat feature for interactive data analysis

docs.title: Managing Your Installation
docs.text:
You can manage your GitHub App installation at any time:

  • GitHub Settings: Visit https://github.com/settings/installations to modify repository access or uninstall
  • Cloud Avenue Portal: Access https://app.cloudavenue.ai/ to view connected installations and configure features

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2 STEP 3

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Click the following link to install our GitHub app: https://github.com/apps/cloud-avenue-data-insights

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories you want to gain insights for. We currently support repositories with Node.js, Debezium, dbt, and Looker codebases. If you would like us to support additional technologies, please feel free to reach out to us at hello@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To configure additional features, such as gaining insights from platforms without GitHub repositories or enabling notifications, create an account and set them up through our portal at https://app.cloudavenue.ai/ or via our API.

docs.title: Integrations
docs.text:
Enterprise Feature

Platform integrations are available for Enterprise accounts. These integrations enable comprehensive lineage tracking, impact analysis, and metadata extraction across your entire data ecosystem.

Cloud Avenue Data Insights provides extensive integration support for modern data platforms, enabling you to track data lineage, understand dependencies, and analyze the impact of changes across your entire data stack.

docs.title: Supported Technologies
docs.text: Cloud Avenue supports integration with the following categories of technologies. Contact our support team at hello@cloudavenue.ai for setup instructions and configuration guidance specific to your environment.

docs.title: BI Tools
docs.text:
Visualize data lineage from your business intelligence platforms:

  • Tableau: Enterprise data visualization and analytics
  • Power BI: Microsoft's business analytics service
  • Looker: Modern business intelligence and data exploration
  • Superset: Open-source data visualization platform
  • Lightdash: Open-source BI for dbt

docs.title: Data Warehouses & Data Lakes
docs.text:
Connect to your cloud data platforms for comprehensive metadata extraction:

  • Snowflake: Cloud data warehouse
  • BigQuery: Google Cloud's serverless data warehouse
  • Redshift: Amazon's cloud data warehouse
  • Databricks: Unified data analytics platform
  • Azure Synapse: Analytics service combining data integration and warehousing
  • Teradata: Enterprise data warehouse platform
  • Athena: Serverless query service for S3
  • Exasol: High-performance analytics database
  • Hive: Data warehouse software for distributed storage
  • Delta Lake: Open-source storage framework
  • Iceberg: Table format for large analytic datasets
  • S3 Data Lake: Amazon S3-based data lakes
  • ADLS Data Lake: Azure Data Lake Storage
  • GCS Data Lake: Google Cloud Storage data lakes

docs.title: Data Integration
docs.text:
Track transformations and data movement across integration platforms:

  • dbt: Data transformation tool
  • Airflow: Workflow orchestration platform
  • Fivetran: Automated data integration
  • Matillion: Cloud-native ETL platform
  • Informatica: Enterprise data integration
  • AWS Glue: Serverless data integration service

docs.title: Databases
docs.text:
Connect to your operational and analytical databases:

  • PostgreSQL: Advanced open-source relational database
  • MySQL: Popular open-source database
  • MongoDB: Document-oriented NoSQL database
  • SQLite: Lightweight embedded database
  • Oracle: Enterprise relational database
  • SQL Server: Microsoft's relational database
  • Azure SQL: Cloud-based SQL database service
  • MariaDB: MySQL-compatible database
  • ClickHouse: Column-oriented database for analytics
  • Cassandra: Distributed NoSQL database
  • CockroachDB: Distributed SQL database
  • Couchbase: Distributed NoSQL cloud database
  • DynamoDB: Amazon's NoSQL database service
  • DB2: IBM's database management system
  • Greenplum: Massively parallel PostgreSQL
  • SingleStore: Distributed SQL database
  • BigTable: Google's NoSQL database service
  • PinoDB: Real-time analytics database
  • Domo Database: Domo's cloud database
  • Presto: Distributed SQL query engine
  • Trino: Fast distributed SQL query engine
  • Impala: MPP SQL query engine
  • Salesforce: CRM platform database
  • SAP ERP: Enterprise resource planning system
  • SAP HANA: In-memory database platform
  • SAS: Analytics software platform

docs.title: Managing Integrations
docs.text: You can view all connected integrations and their status in the Integrations section of the Cloud Avenue portal.

docs.title: Getting Started with Integrations
docs.text:
To set up an integration for your organization:

  1. Contact Support: Email hello@cloudavenue.ai with:

    • The platform(s) you want to integrate
    • Your use case and requirements
    • Any specific configuration needs

  2. Receive Setup Instructions: Our team will provide:

    • Step-by-step configuration guide
    • Required credentials and permissions
    • API endpoints or connection details

  3. Configure Connection: Follow the provided instructions to:

    • Set up authentication
    • Configure metadata extraction
    • Test the connection

  4. Monitor Integration: Once configured:

    • View integration status in the portal
    • Access extracted metadata
    • Explore lineage graphs and dependencies

docs.title: Integration Benefits
docs.text:
Connected integrations enable:

  • Automated Lineage Tracking: Understand data flow across your entire stack
  • Impact Analysis: See what's affected by schema or code changes
  • Metadata Search: Find entities across all connected platforms
  • Dependency Mapping: Visualize relationships between tables, dashboards, and models
  • Change Intelligence: Smart PR comments with downstream impact details

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
For assistance with integrations:

  • Email: hello@cloudavenue.ai

docs.title: dbt
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with dbt codebases, then click Save.

docs.title: Debezium
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with Debezium configurations, then click Save.

docs.title: Fivetran
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to Integrations section of our portal and click Add Integration: Integrations.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill in the API Secret and Connection Details (apiKey=<API_KEY>). You can generate the API Key and Secret by visiting Fivetran’s API documentation.

docs.title: Lightdash
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to Integrations section of our portal and click Add Integration: Integrations.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill in the API Secret and Connection Details (lightdashDomain=app.lightdash.cloud,projectUuid=<PROJECT_UUID>). You will need to generate a Lightdash access token and locate the project UUID by referring to Lightdash's documentation

docs.title: Looker
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with Looker codebases, then click Save.

docs.title: Node.JS
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to our app directly in GitHub, or click Manage in the GitHub Apps section of our portal: GitHub Apps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Select the repositories with Node.js codebases, then click Save.

docs.title: Slack
docs.text: STEP 1 STEP 2

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Navigate to Notifications section of our portal and click Add Subscription: Notifications.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill in the name and Webhook URL. You can generate the Webhook URL by referring to Slack's documentation
